ModuleDescription: This module introduces the basic techniques in stochastic analysis as well as their applications in mathematical finance. Major topics: Brownian motion, stochastic calculus, stochastic differential equations, mathematical markets, arbitrage, completeness, optimal stopping problems, stochastic control, risk-neutral pricing, and generalized Black-Scholes models.
Prerequisite: MA4262 or MA3245 or MA4269 or departmental approval
